intro: Dyschoriste poliodes var. obispoensis, commonly known as the Obispo's dyschoriste, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of California. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
